reasoning: Tricuspid valve prolapse measured as prevalence, not incidence. Large echocardiographic study (N=118,000) reported 0.3% prevalence; other studies report 0.3-3.2% range (~300-3,200 per 100k). Using mid-range estimate 1% (1,000 per 100k). Diagnostic criteria not well-established historically; high variability in reported rates.
source: Characteristics and Significance of Tricuspid Valve Prolapse in a Large Multidecade Echocardiographic Study; Levy F et al. PMC7796941.
